parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Account ID

responseMessages.message: Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied
Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie
Forbidden due to the user missing the necessary privileges

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of Account

parameters.name: owner_account_id
parameters.description: ID of parent account. If omitted, parent is set to the account of the creating user.

parameters.name: contact_first_name
parameters.description: First name of primary contact for account

parameters.name: contact_last_name
parameters.description: Last name of primary contact for account

parameters.name: contact_email
parameters.description: Email of primary contact for account

parameters.name: contact_street
parameters.description: Array of strings representing 1 or more parts of a street address of primary contact for account

parameters.name: contact_city
parameters.description: City of primary contact for account.

parameters.name: contact_state
parameters.description: State/province of primary contact for account.

parameters.name: contact_postal_code
parameters.description: Zip/postal code of primary contact for account.

parameters.name: contact_country
parameters.description: Country of primary contact for account.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Timezone of Account. Defaults to US/Pacific.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Account status. This can only be edited by superusers and account_superusers of the parent/owner account.  'realm_root' can only be set by superusers.

parameters.name: access_restriction
parameters.description: Each entry in the list contains a restriction. Possible values: 'enable_mobile' = If present this account can has access to mobile clients. 'enable_ip_restrictions' = if present, and if allowable_ip_address_ranges has been specified, limits logins to the address ranges specified.

parameters.name: allowable_ip_address_ranges
parameters.description: Each entry in the list specifies one address range.  Entries use the ‘/’ format.  For example, to limit access to 192.168.123.0-192.168.123.255, the entry would be 192.168.123.0/24. If no entries are present, 0.0.0.0/0 i s implied.

parameters.name: session_duration
parameters.description: Session duration in minutes.  Session duration of 0 means 'stay logged in forever'

parameters.name: holiday
parameters.description: List of dates that during which holidays are observed.  Format for dates is YYYYMMDD

parameters.name: work_days
parameters.description: String of length 7.  Each position in the string corresponds to a day of the week.  Monday is position 0, Tuesday is position 1, etc... Each character in the string can have a value of 1 or 0.  1 means that this day is a work day.

parameters.name: work_hours
parameters.description: Two entries.  Each entry contains a time expressed in local time.  The first entry in the list is the work day start time .  The second entry in the ist is the stop time. Times are represented using a 24 hour clock and are formatted as HHMM.  For example, 8AM would be 0800 and 5PM would be 1700.

parameters.name: alert_mode
parameters.description: List of possible alert modes as defined for this account.

parameters.name: active_alert_mode
parameters.description: Must be blank or one of the values defined in alert_mode list.

parameters.name: default_colo
parameters.description: Name of the colo in which this account data for this account will be stored by default.

parameters.name: default_camera_passwords
parameters.description: Comma-delimited string of default camera passwords

parameters.name: is_without_initial_user
parameters.description: Indicates whether you want to NOT create an initial user with the new account. Defaults to 0, meaning an initial user (with is_account_superuser=1) will be created using the info from “contact_first_name/contact_last_name/contact_email” arguments of this new account.  If this is set to 1, NO initial user will be created.

parameters.name: is_initial_user_not_admin
parameters.description: Indicates whether you want do NOT want the initial user to be an admin.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of Account

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of Account

parameters.name: contact_first_name
parameters.description: First name of primary contact for account

parameters.name: contact_last_name
parameters.description: Last name of primary contact for account

parameters.name: contact_email
parameters.description: Email of primary contact for account

parameters.name: contact_street
parameters.description: Array of strings representing 1 or more parts of a street address of primary contact for account

parameters.name: contact_city
parameters.description: City of primary contact for account.

parameters.name: contact_state
parameters.description: State/province of primary contact for account.

parameters.name: contact_postal_code
parameters.description: Zip/postal code of primary contact for account.

parameters.name: contact_country
parameters.description: Country of primary contact for account.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Timezone of Account. Defaults to US/Pacific.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Account status. This can only be edited by superusers and account_superusers of the parent/owner account.  'realm_root' can only be set by superusers.

parameters.name: access_restriction
parameters.description: Each entry in the list contains a restriction. Possible values: 'enable_mobile' = If present this account can has access to mobile clients. 'enable_ip_restrictions' = if present, and if allowable_ip_address_ranges has been specified, limits logins to the address ranges specified.

parameters.name: allowable_ip_address_ranges
parameters.description: Each entry in the list specifies one address range.  Entries use the ‘/’ format.  For example, to limit access to 192.168.123.0-192.168.123.255, the entry would be 192.168.123.0/24. If no entries are present, 0.0.0.0/0 i s implied.

parameters.name: session_duration
parameters.description: Session duration in minutes.  Session duration of 0 means 'stay logged in forever'

parameters.name: holiday
parameters.description: List of dates that during which holidays are observed.  Format for dates is YYYYMMDD

parameters.name: work_days
parameters.description: String of length 7.  Each position in the string corresponds to a day of the week.  Monday is position 0, Tuesday is position 1, etc... Each character in the string can have a value of 1 or 0.  1 means that this day is a work day.

parameters.name: work_hours
parameters.description: Two entries.  Each entry contains a time expressed in local time.  The first entry in the list is the work day start time .  The second entry in the ist is the stop time. Times are represented using a 24 hour clock and are formatted as HHMM.  For example, 8AM would be 0800 and 5PM would be 1700.

parameters.name: alert_mode
parameters.description: List of possible alert modes as defined for this account.

parameters.name: active_alert_mode
parameters.description: Must be blank or one of the values defined in alert_mode list.

parameters.name: default_colo
parameters.description: Name of the colo in which this account data for this account will be stored by default.

parameters.name: default_camera_passwords
parameters.description: Comma-delimited string of default camera passwords

parameters.name: camera_shares
parameters.description: Array of arrays, with each sub array representing a camera to be shared to 1 or more email addresses.  First element of sub array is action, with 'm' for add/update, and 'd' for delete. Second element of sub array is camera ID. Third element of sub array is an array of email addresses, but only applies to the 'm' action. Example: [['m', '12345678', ['test@testing.com','test2@testing.com]]]

parameters.name: is_revoke_admins
parameters.description: Indicates whether you want to revoke all Admin permissions for the users in the account.

parameters.name: is_custom_brand
parameters.description: Indicates whether branding is enabled for the account

parameters.name: brand_logo_small
parameters.description: Base64 encoded image for the branded small logo

parameters.name: brand_logo_large
parameters.description: Base64 encoded image for the branded large logo

parameters.name: brand_subdomain
parameters.description: Sub domain for the branded url

parameters.name: brand_corp_url
parameters.description: Corporate web site url

parameters.name: brand_name
parameters.description: Branded company name

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Account ID

responseMessages.message: Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied
Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie
Forbidden due to the user missing the necessary privileges
Account not found with the supplied ID

operations.notes: Returns array of arrays, with each sub-array representing an account available to the user. Please note that the ListAccount model definition below has property keys, but that's only for reference purposes since it's actually just a standard array.

responseMessages.message: Unexpected or non-identifiable arguments are supplied
Unauthorized due to invalid session cookie
Forbidden due to the user missing the necessary privileges

contact_first_name.description: First name of primary contact for account

contact_last_name.description: Last name of primary contact for account

contact_email.description: Email of primary contact for account

contact_street.description: Array of strings representing 1 or more parts of a street address of primary contact for account

contact_city.description: City of primary contact for account

contact_state.description: State/province of primary contact for account

contact_postal_code.description: Zip/postal code of primary contact for account

contact_country.description: Country of primary contact for account

timezone.description: Timezone of the account.  Defaults to US/Pacific.

utc_offset.description: Signed integer offset in seconds of the timezone from UTC

access_restriction.description: Each entry in the list contains a restriction. Possible values: 'enable_mobile' = If present this account can has access to mobile clients. 'enable_ip_restrictions' = if present, and if allowable_ip_address_ranges has been specified, limits logins to the address ranges specified.

allowable_ip_address_range.description: Each entry in the list specifies one address range.  Entries use the ‘/’ format.  For example, to limit access to 192.168.123.0-192.168.123.255, the entry would be 192.168.123.0/24. If no entries are present, 0.0.0.0/0 i s implied.

session_duration.description: session duration in minutes.  Session duration of 0 means 'stay logged in forever'

holiday.description: List of dates that during which holidays are observed.  Format for dates is YYYYMMDD

work_days.description: String of length 7.  Each position in the string corresponds to a day of the week.  Monday is position 0, Tuesday is position 1, etc... Each character in the string can have a value of 1 or 0.  1 means that this day is a work day.

work_hours.description: Two entries.  Each entry contains a time expressed in local time.  The first entry in the list is the work day start time .  The second entry in the list is the stop time. Times are represented using a 24 hour clock and are formatted as HHMM.  For example, 8AM would be 0800 and 5PM would be 1700.

alert_mode.description: List of possible alert modes as defined for this account.

active_alert_mode.description: Must be blank or one of the values defined in alert_mode list.

default_colo.description: Name of the colo in which this account data for this account will be stored by default.

default_camera_passwords.description: Comma-delimited string of default camera passwords

camera_shares.description: Array of arrays, with each sub array representing a camera to be shared to 1 or more email addresses.  First element of sub array is action, with 'm' for add/update, and 'd' for delete. Second element of sub array is camera ID. Third element of sub array is an array of email addresses, but only applies to the 'm' action. Example: [['m', '12345678', ['test@testing.com','test2@testing.com]]]

is_master.description: Indicates whether the account is a Master account (1) or not (0)

is_active.description: Indicates whether the account is Enabled (1) or not (0). This parameter matches the 'is_enabled' parameter is the account/list API call

is_inactive.description: Indicates whether the account is inactive (1) or not (0)

is_suspended.description: Indicates whether the account is Suspended (1) or not (0)

product_edition.description: The product edition the account is using

camera_quantity.description: The total number of cameras the account is allowed to use

is_custom_brand_allowed.description: Indicates whether the account is allowed to have branding (1) or not (0)

is_custom_brand.description: Indicates whether the account has branding enabled (1) or not (0)

brand_logo_small.description: Base64 encoded image for the branded small logo

brand_logo_large.description: Base64 encoded image for the branded small logo

brand_subdomain.description: Sub domain for the branded url

camera_online_count.description: Number of cameras currently online in the account

camera_count.description: Number of cameras currently in the account

user_count.description: Number of users currently in the account

is_suspended.description: Indicates the account is Suspended (1) or not (0)

is_inactive.description: Indicates the account is Inactive (1) or not (0)

is_enabled.description: Indicates the account is Enabled (1) or not (0)

product_edition.description: Product edition in use by the account

bridge_online_count.description: Number of online bridges in the account

bridge_active_count.description: Number of active bridges in the account (Active means there is at least 1 attached camera)

bridge_count.description: Total number of bridges in the account

camera_off_count.description: Number of 'Off' cameras in the account

camera_available_count.description: Number of cameras that are available (aka 'unattached') in the account

is_active.description: boolean (0 or 1) indicating whether the account is 'active' (i.e. at least 1 attached camera)

last_login.description: Timestamp (EEN format) of the last time a user logged in

average_retention_days.description: Average retention period (days) across all cameras in the account
